channel.title: Torque OBD 2 Engine Diagnostics?
channel.description:
Came upon this on blackdroid.net
Anyways I have the app now I need the bluetooth module...opinions?
http://torque-bhp.com/software/torque-android-obd2-adapters/
I think its pretty cool because of all the data it can provide that you cant otherwise get easily. But the $99 dollar price tag for the module seems cheap but I am willing to go for it if I think it is useful enough.

item.title: Torque OBD 2 Engine Diagnostics?
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Hmm well I just kinda liked of being able to put my phone on my dash and it would just work whenever I turned the car on. I would be using it more for looking at performance information than diagnosing problems.

Read full topic

item.title: Torque OBD 2 Engine Diagnostics?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

I agree with Mopar, though I wish I could recommend a good cheap scanner. We went through a few and they’re all fucking awful, in the end had to buy one of the expensive Snapon ones (it does more than OBD-II, but still)

I’m sure decent cheap ones must exist though, and we just happened to accidentally buy crap every time.

Read full topic

item.title: Torque OBD 2 Engine Diagnostics?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You can buy an entire OBDII scanner for about $99, so why would you just buy a module to use with your phone? I guess maybe there are advantages to that program, but I just don’t know.

Whenever I need a scanner, I just rent one for free from my local Autozone, it doesn’t cost a dime. Of course, most of my vehicles aren’t new enough for OBDII, so most of the time I’m doing stuff the old fashioned way anyway.

Read full topic
